revised_title: Interrelationship between the Rates of Production of Carbon Dioxide, Lactic Acid, and Alcohol in Potato Tubers under Anaerobic Conditions
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on potato tubers under anaerobic conditions, studying the production rates of carbon dioxide, lactic acid, and alcohol. They found that lactic acid and alcohol were produced alongside carbon dioxide, and that a marked Pasteur effect was present. The results help reconcile previous findings on lactic acid and alcohol production in plants.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
